data.message:
The first time I heard Eminem was when my dad and my brother inserted a blank CD that comes with the collection of random tracks like Snoop Dogg, Bow Wow, Dr. Dre, 2Pac, Destiny's Child, Lil Wayne, T.I, Bone Thugs-N-Harmony and others. My brother played the song whenever we drive to town and back cause I used to live on the farm, the track my brother played was called "Mockingbird" and "Just Lose It". (2010) 

Five years later, I rapped one of his songs which was called "Role Model" for the first time onstage in front of everybody, I was rapping onstage and everybody enjoyed it...I do not know if they understand the song, it was a good performance as I rapped for the first time. 
Eminem became my idol for quite some time. The Slim Shady LP was my favourite album from him and The Marshall Mathers LP. 
A year later, I performed another song which was called "Low, Down, Dirty" from The Slim Shady EP and I rapped it again onstage and then the music stopped and I performes an acapella and the microphone was not working. I got nervous as I continued rapping and everybody didn't listen to it but only the front crowd heard me and that last bit I said "bring ya girlfriend onstage, so you can see if my ding-a-ling is gone fit in her" and everybody freaked out, I walked offstage and I didn't realize that they wanted me to come back onstage, but I didn't know. I should of went back there. They're gonna remember me who rapped in front of a thousand people...I enjoyed it, missed the performance. Hope you enjoy reading this comment.
